result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:04 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Taeshaun I Chapman appeared by Zoom video, in custody at Milw. Co. Jail.  Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Taeshaun I Chapman.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Atty. Broze provides an update; she is asking the matter be set for plea and sentencing at the end of November.  No objection the the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Atty. Broze requests that her client appear by video for the next court date.  Defendant also confirms he would prefer to appear by video.  Defendant to appear by Zoom video from the facility he is at for the next court date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Broze provides an update, she has discovery and an offer.  Atty. Broze requests one additional further proceedings date to allow time to review the offer with her client.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Defendant to appear by Zoom from Milwaukee Co. Jail for the next court date.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Broze advises that she has not been in contact with her client and does not know why he has not appeared today.  State requests a capias be issued and bail be revoked and/or forfeited.  Atty. Broze requests if a capias is issued it be stayed as the defendant has not missed a prior court hearing.  Court to issue a capias and orders bail be forfeited.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 10:57 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Taeshaun I Chapman in court.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Coutr reviews the case on the record and notes the defendant was not eligible for Public Defender.  Court inquires how the defendant plans to proceed and if he plans to retain counsel.  Defendant advises he needs additional time to retain counsel.  Court inquires if he was advised of filing a petition for court appointed attorney.  Defendant advises he did complete the petition for court appointed attorney.  Court reviews the petition on the record.  Court questions the defendant with regards to information on the petition.  Court cannot appoint if there is a chance the defendant qualifies for a public defender.  Court takes a brief recess to allow time for the defendant to be evaluated by Atty. Gutierrez, Court takes a break at 11:03 a.m.  Court goes back on the record at 11:09 a.m.; all appearances remain the same.  Atty. Daniel Gutierrez appears as a friend of the Court.  Atty. Gutierrez advises that the defendant does not qualify for a Public Defender.  Court will then proceed with the petition for court appointed attorney and reviews the petition with the defendant on the record.  Court will grant the petition for court appointed attorney.  Court will order repayment at $50.00 per month effective 07/01/2022.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel in about 30 days.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on May 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
